<section class="header container-fluid">
    <header class="hero row">
        <section class="span2 offset2">
            <img src="/bundles/phpdocumentorwebsite/images/logo2.png" />
        </section>
        <section class="span5 offset1">
            <h1>
                <em>phpDocumentor</em> analyzes your <em>code</em><br />
                to create great <em>documentation</em>
            </h1>
            <p>
                phpDocumentor enables you to generate documentation from your PHP
                source code. This documentation provides an in-depth view of your
                project to you, your consumers and contributors.
            </p>
            <a class="button demo" href="http://demo.phpdoc.org">Demo</a>
            <a class="button learn-more" href="http://phpdoc.org/docs/latest">Learn more</a>
        </section>
    </header>
</section>

<hr style="border-style: solid; border-width: 1px; border-color: #8dd35f; margin-top: 5px;" />

<section class="container">

    <section class="row">
        <section class="span8">
            <article class="content-overview tab-content">
                <h1>
                    <nav>
                        <a href="#why-use-phpdocumentor" class="active">Why use phpDocumentor</a>
                                                                    </nav>
                </h1>

                <section id="why-use-phpdocumentor" class="tab-pane active">
                    <section>
                        <h2>What is phpDocumentor?</h2>
                        <img
                            src="/bundles/phpdocumentorwebsite/images/icons/icon_logo_green.png"
                            alt="phpDocumentor"
                        />

                        <p>
                            phpDocumentor 2 is a tool that makes it possible to generate documentation directly from your PHP
                            source code. With this you can provide your consumers with more information regarding the
                            functionality embedded within your source and not just what is usable to them from your user
                            interface.
                        </p>

                        <p>
                            Documentation generated by phpDocumentor 2 does not aim to be a replacement for conventional
                            documentation but is rather supplemental, or reference, documentation.This proves to be
                            useful in the following example situations:
                        </p>
                        <ul>
                            <li>Sets of libraries or applications providing an API, such as phpDocumentor 2 itself</li>
                            <li>Frameworks, such as Zend Framework or Symfony</li>
                            <li>Pluggable architectures, such as WordPress or PyroCMS</li>
                            <li>Long-running, complex projects, to help you find the right function or method for the job</li>
                        </ul>
                    </section>
                    <section>
                        <h2>Templates</h2>
                        <img
                                src="/bundles/phpdocumentorwebsite/images/icons/icon_templates_green.png"
                                alt="Templates"
                                />

                        <p>
                            phpDocumentor 2 contains an incredibly flexible template system which enables you to alter
                            your output in any way imaginable. This can range from simply applying your own branding
                            for the HTML output by merely altering a couple of CSS files to determining which types of
                            output are generated and where they are made available.
                        </p>
                    </section>
                    <section>
                        <h2>Code Analysis</h2>
                        <img
                                src="/bundles/phpdocumentorwebsite/images/icons/icon_charts_green.png"
                                alt="Code Analysis"
                                />

                        <p>
                            phpDocumentor 2 is capable of extracting interesting information and presenting it in the
                            form of graphs and reports. The following are currently supported:
                        </p>
                        <ul>
                            <li>An inheritance diagram showing all subclassing and implementing of interfaces.</li>
                            <li>Reporting errors in your source code's inline documentation.</li>
                            <li>Reporting which elements are marked as deprecated.</li>
                            <li>Reporting where TODOs are placed in your code and what is to be done.</li>
                        </ul>
                        <p>
                            This list will only grow in the future to help you determine where to invest your resources
                            in order to make your code more stable and maintainable.
                        </p>
                    </section>
                </section>

                <section id="getting-started" class="tab-pane">
                    <section>
                        <h2>How does it work?</h2>
                    </section>
                    <section>
                        <h2>Installing</h2>
                    </section>
                    <section>
                        <h2>Writing the first DocBlocks</h2>
                    </section>
                    <section>
                        <h2>Generating the documentation</h2>
                    </section>
                </section>

                <section id="primer-on-docblocks" class="tab-pane">
                </section>
            </article>
        </section>

        <section class="span4" id="quickstart">
            <article id="installing">
                <h2>Installing</h2>
                <div class="accordion" id="installation">
                    <div class="accordion-group">
                        <div class="accordion-heading">
                            <a class="accordion-toggle" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#installation" href="#install-pear">
                                <i class="icon-chevron-right"></i> Using PEAR
                            </a>
                        </div>
                        <div id="install-pear" class="accordion-body collapse in">
                            <div class="accordion-inner">
                                <p>With <a href="">PEAR</a> installed, please run the following commands:</p>
                                <pre><code class="language-php">pear channel-discover pear.phpdoc.org
pear install phpdoc/phpDocumentor</code></pre>
                                <p>
                                    Once the installation is complete a global command, called <code>phpdoc</code>, will be
                                    available.
                                </p>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="accordion-group">
                        <div class="accordion-heading">
                            <a class="accordion-toggle" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#installation" href="#install-composer">
                                <i class="icon-chevron-right"></i> Using Composer
                            </a>
                        </div>
                        <div id="install-composer" class="accordion-body collapse">
                            <div class="accordion-inner">
                                <p>
                                    Add a dependency to
                                    <a href="https://packagist.org/packages/phpdocumentor/phpdocumentor">phpdocumentor/phpdocumentor</a>
                                    to the <code>require-dev</code> section of your project's <code>composer.json</code>
                                    configuration file, and update your application.
                                </p>

                                <p>
                                    The following code is an example of a minimal <code>composer.json</code> file:
                                </p>
                                <pre><code class="language-javascript">{
    "require-dev": {
        "phpdocumentor/phpdocumentor": "2.*"
    }
}</code></pre>
                                <p>
                                    Once the installation is complete there will be a command <code>phpdoc.php</code> in
                                    the binary folder of your application (<code>/vendor/bin</code> by default).
                                </p>
                                <p class="alert alert-info">
                                    <strong>Hint</strong>: phpDocumentor consumes a fair amount of dependencies, if this is inconvenient
                                    then we suggest you choose one of the other installation options.
                                </p>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="accordion-group">
                        <div class="accordion-heading">
                            <a class="accordion-toggle" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#installation" href="#install-phar">
                                <i class="icon-chevron-right"></i> As a PHAR
                            </a>
                        </div>
                        <div id="install-phar" class="accordion-body collapse">
                            <div class="accordion-inner">
                                <p>
                                    <a href="http://phpdoc.org/phpDocumentor.phar">
                                        All you need to do is download the phar binary.
                                    </a>
                                </p>
                                <p>That's it. Really.</p>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="accordion-group">
                        <div class="accordion-heading">
                            <a class="accordion-toggle" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#installation" href="#install-manual">
                                <i class="icon-chevron-right"></i> Manually
                            </a>
                        </div>
                        <div id="install-manual" class="accordion-body collapse">
                            <div class="accordion-inner">
                                <p>To do a manual installation, follow these steps</p>
                                <ol>
                                    <li>
                                        Locate the latest release on the
                                        <a href="https://github.com/phpDocumentor/phpDocumentor2/releases">releases page for phpDocumentor2 on GitHub</a>
                                    </li>
                                    <li>Download the attached tarball (not the source code!)</li>
                                    <li>Extract the downloaded tarball into your destination directory.</li>
                                </ol>
                                <p>
                                    After you have done the above can the executable be found at
                                    <code>bin/phpdoc.php</code> in the installation directory.
                                </p>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </article>
        </section>
    </section>

    </section>

    <section class="styles-preview">
        <h1>Templates</h1>

			jQuery('.advancedSelect').chosen({"disable_search_threshold":10,"search_contains":true,"allow_single_deselect":true,"placeholder_text_multiple":"Type or select some options","placeholder_text_single":"Select an option","no_results_text":"No results match"});

jQuery(document).ready(function() {
	var value, searchword = jQuery('#mod-finder-searchword84');

		// Get the current value.
		value = searchword.val();

		// If the current value equals the default value, clear it.
		searchword.on('focus', function ()
		{
			var el = jQuery(this);

			if (el.val() === 'Search ...')
			{
				el.val('');
			}
		});

		// If the current value is empty, set the previous value.
		searchword.on('blur', function ()
		{
			var el = jQuery(this);

			if (!el.val())
			{
				el.val(value);
			}
		});

		jQuery('#mod-finder-searchform84').on('submit', function (e)
		{
			e.stopPropagation();
			var advanced = jQuery('#mod-finder-advanced84');

			// Disable select boxes with no value selected.
			if (advanced.length)
			{
				advanced.find('select').each(function (index, el)
				{
					var el = jQuery(el);

					if (!el.val())
					{
						el.attr('disabled', 'disabled');
					}
				});
			}
		});
	var suggest = jQuery('#mod-finder-searchword84').autocomplete({
		serviceUrl: '/component/finder/?task=suggestions.suggest&amp;format=json&amp;tmpl=component',
		paramName: 'q',
		minChars: 1,
		maxHeight: 400,
		width: 300,
		zIndex: 9999,
		deferRequestBy: 500
	});});
	</script>

							<div class="moduletable">
						

<div class="custom"  >
	<p class="lead">There is always a great deal of Joomla! development activity underway and communicating with other developers in the community is essential. This site is a resource for anyone looking to build or maintain software based on the Joomla! platform.</p></div>
		</div>
			<div class="moduletable">
						

<div class="custom"  >
	<h2>Where to Start</h2>
<div id="startcontainer">
<div class="row-fluid center start">
<div class="span4"><img src="/images/joomlacms.png" alt="Joomla CMS" />
<div class="caption"><a class="btn btn-large btn-block btn-primary" href="/cms/downloads.html">Download</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/cms/documentation.html">Documentation</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/cms/support.html">Support</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/cms/report-an-issue.html">Report an Issue</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/cms/volunteer.html">Volunteer</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/cms/contribute.html">Contribute</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/cms/roadmap.html">Roadmap</a></div>
</div>
<div class="span4"><img src="/images/issue_tracker_logo.png" alt="Joomla Issue Tracker" />
<div class="caption"><a class="btn btn-large btn-block btn-primary" href="https://issues.joomla.org" target="_blank">Review Tracker</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/tracker/volunteer-activity.html">Volunteer Activity</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/tracker/volunteer.html">Volunteer</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/tracker/report-an-issue.html">Report New Issue</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/tracker/roadmap.html">Roadmap</a></div>

<div class="caption">
<p><a class="btn btn-large btn-block btn-primary" href="/framework/downloads.html">Download</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/framework/documentation.html">Documentation</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/framework/support.html">Support</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/framework/report-an-issue.html">Report an Issue</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/framework/contribute.html">Contribute</a> <a class="btn btn-large btn-block" href="/framework/roadmap.html">Roadmap</a></p>

					<div class="blog-featured" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/Blog">

<div class="items-leading clearfix">
			<div class="leading-0 clearfix" 
			itemprop="blogPost" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/BlogPosting">
			

	<h2 class="item-title" itemprop="headline">
			<a href="/news/674-statement-about-the-new-router-feature-for-3-7-0.html" itemprop="url">
			Statement about the new Router feature for 3.7.0		</a>
		</h2>





			<div class="pull-none item-image">
			<a href="/news/674-statement-about-the-new-router-feature-for-3-7-0.html"><img src="/images/news/joomla-router.jpg" alt="Joomla router" itemprop="thumbnailUrl"/></a>
		</div>


<p>Some weeks ago we published the information that we are looking into the router code. Since then we have checked with a team of developers the code for the new router. The initial reason was an issue about it not responding to invalid URLs with the 404. Here we would like to share the reasons why we have came to the conclusion to remove the new router from the 3.7 release.</p>
<p>Before we go into the details we would like to share that we have also thought about the path forward. We know that many people were looking forward to a better router for Joomla. Our plan is to work over the next 2-3 months intensively on the router and <strong>we plan a 3.8 release with a new router included</strong>. This will be supported by a Google Summer of Code Project and we will setup a team of developers and SEO experts to help to make it the best router the Joomla! Project has ever seen.</p>



	
<p class="readmore">
	<a class="btn" href="/news/674-statement-about-the-new-router-feature-for-3-7-0.html" itemprop="url">
		<span class="icon-chevron-right"></span>
		Read more: Statement about the new Router feature for 3.7.0	</a>
</p>



		</div>
			</div>
	
		
		<div class="items-row cols-2 row-0 row-fluid">
					<div class="item column-1 span6"
				itemprop="blogPost" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/BlogPosting">
			

	<h2 class="item-title" itemprop="headline">
			<a href="/news/673-preparing-for-phpcs-2-x-support.html" itemprop="url">
			Preparing for PHPCS 2.x Support		</a>
		</h2>





			<div class="pull-none item-image">
			<a href="/news/673-preparing-for-phpcs-2-x-support.html"><img src="/images/news/joomla-coding-standards.jpg" alt="Joomla Coding Standards" itemprop="thumbnailUrl"/></a>
		</div>


<p>The Joomla! Project is pleased to announce that we are (finally) ready to release an alpha version of the <a href="https://github.com/joomla/coding-standards">Joomla! Coding Standards</a> which is compatible with PHP_CodeSniffer 2.x. In preparation for this release, we will be making some structural changes to our coding standards repository which may affect developers using this repository.</p>



	
<p class="readmore">
	<a class="btn" href="/news/673-preparing-for-phpcs-2-x-support.html" itemprop="url">
		<span class="icon-chevron-right"></span>
		Read more: Preparing for PHPCS 2.x Support	</a>
</p>



			</div>
			
			
	
					<div class="item column-2 span6"
				itemprop="blogPost" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/BlogPosting">
			

	<h2 class="item-title" itemprop="headline">
			<a href="/news/671-joomla-3-7-beta-3-released-for-testing.html" itemprop="url">
			Joomla! 3.7 Beta 3 Released for Testing		</a>
		</h2>





			<div class="pull-none item-image">
			<a href="/news/671-joomla-3-7-beta-3-released-for-testing.html"><img src="/images/news/joomla-37-beta3.jpg" alt="Joomla 3.7 beta 3" itemprop="thumbnailUrl"/></a>
		</div>


<p>The Joomla! Project is pleased to announce the availability of <a href="https://github.com/joomla/joomla-cms/releases" target="_blank"> Joomla! CMS 3.7.0 Beta 3</a>. Community members are asked to download and install the package in order to provide quality assurance for the forthcoming 3.7 release.</p>



	
<p class="readmore">
	<a class="btn" href="/news/671-joomla-3-7-beta-3-released-for-testing.html" itemprop="url">
		<span class="icon-chevron-right"></span>
		Read more: Joomla! 3.7 Beta 3 Released for Testing	</a>
</p>



			</div>
			
			
		</div>

				<div id="SubNav">
	<h3>Navigation</h3>
	<ul class="SubMenuCMSListMenuUL" id="SubMenu">
		<li class="SubMenuCMSListMenuHighlightedLIFirst"><a href="/Home.aspx" class="SubMenuCMSListMenuLinkHighlighted" >Home</a>
		<ul class="SubMenuCMSListMenuUL">
			<li class="SubMenuCMSListMenuLIFirst" style=""><a href="/Home/Call-for-Papers.aspx" class="SubMenuCMSListMenuLink" style="" >Call for Papers</a></li>

				<h3>
	&nbsp;</h3>
<p>
	<br />
	<br />
	<br />
	<span style="font-size:14px;"><span style="color: rgb(128, 128, 128);">Follow us on: @ICE_Conference</span></span><br />
	<br />
	&nbsp;</p>
<p>
	<a href="https://www.xing.com/net/pria3ee66x/ice/"><img alt="xing.png" src="/getattachment/xing.png.aspx?width=36&amp;height=35" style="width: 36px; height: 35px" /></a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="http://www.linkedin.com/groups?gid=3032088&amp;trk=hb_side_g"><img alt="59-linkedin-logo-(1).jpg" src="/getattachment/59-linkedin-logo-(1).jpg.aspx?width=38&amp;height=35" style="width: 38px; height: 35px" /></a>&nbsp; <a href="http://www.facebook.com/ICEConference/" target="_blank"><img alt="facebook.png" src="/getattachment/facebook.png.aspx?width=39&amp;height=36" style="width: 39px; height: 36px" /></a></p>

        	<div id="Col2">
<div class="Bread">
	<h1>Join us at Madeira Island, The Pearl of the Atlantic, Portugal 2017 



 </h1>
</div>
<div class="Content">
	<div>
	<div style="text-align: center;">
		<span style="color:#cc3300;"><u><span style="font-size:22px;"><strong>LATEST NEWS</strong></span></u></span><br />
		<br />
		<br />
		<strong style="font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: rgb(204, 51, 0);">****</span></span></strong><span style="font-size:16px;"><strong><span style="color:#cc3300;">&nbsp;EXTENDED DEADLINE</span></strong> <strong>for submission.<br />
		Responding to several requests, the deadline for submissions is extentended to <span style="font-size:18px;"><span style="color:#cc3300;">15<sup>th</sup> April 2017</span></span>&nbsp;</strong></span><strong style="font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: rgb(204, 51, 0);">****</span></span></strong><br />
		<br />
		&nbsp;</div>
	<div style="text-align: center;">
		<strong><span style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: rgb(204, 51, 0);">*** </span></span></strong><span style="font-size:18px;">Check out the ICE/IEEE ITMC&nbsp;</span><strong style="color: rgb(46, 46, 46); text-align: center;"><span style="font-size:16px;"><font color="#0066cc"><u><a href="http://www.ice-conference.org/Home/Special-Sessions.aspx" target="_blank">Special Sessions</a> and <a href="http://www.ice-conference.org/Home/Workshops.aspx" target="_blank">Workshops</a></u></font></span><span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 18px; white-space: pre-wrap;"> </span></strong><span style="color: rgb(46, 46, 46); text-align: center; font-size: 13px; font-family: Arial; white-space: pre-wrap;"><span style="font-size:18px;">and submit your paper.</span></span><strong style="text-align: center;"><span style="font-size:22px;"><span style="color:#cc3300;"><span style="font-family: Arial; white-space: pre-wrap;"> </span></span></span><span style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: rgb(204, 51, 0);">***</span></span></strong></div>
	<div style="text-align: center;">
		<br />
		<br />
		<strong style="font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: rgb(204, 51, 0);">****&nbsp;</span></span></strong><strong><span style="font-size:14px;"><span style="font-size:16px;"><span style="color:#cc3300;">SUBMISSIONS NOW AVAILABLE</span></span>:&nbsp;<u><a href="http://www.ice-conference.org/Home/Submissions.aspx" target="_blank">http://www.ice-conference.org/Home/Submissions.aspx</a></u>&nbsp;</span></strong><strong style="font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: rgb(204, 51, 0);">****</span></span></strong><br />
		<br />
		<br />
		<strong><span style="color: rgb(0, 102, 204);"><u><span style="font-size: 22px;"><img alt="linha.png" src="/getattachment/Home/linha.png.aspx;;?width=850&amp;height=7" style="width: 850px; height: 7px;" title="linha.png" /></span></u></span></strong><br />
		<br />
		<strong><span style="font-size: 14px;"><a href="https://www.cen.eu/Pages/default.aspx" target="_blank"><img alt="CEN.jpg" src="/getattachment/Home/CEN.jpg.aspx;;" style="width: 48px; height: 37px;" title="CEN.jpg" /></a><span style="font-size: 16px;">CEN Workshop Big Data Plenary Meeting in parallel with the 23<sup>rd</sup> ICE/IEEE ITMC</span></span></strong><br />
		<br />
		<span style="font-size: 14px;"><span style="color: rgb(204, 51, 0);">&nbsp;</span></span><strong style="font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: rgb(204, 51, 0);">****</span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 14px;"><span style="color: rgb(204, 51, 0);"><span style="font-size: 22px;">&nbsp;</span></span>Don&rsquo;t miss the opportunity to&nbsp;</span><strong style="font-size: 14px;"><u>become member of the 23</u><sup>rd</sup><u> ICE/IEEE ITMC International Organizing Committee!</u>&nbsp;</strong><strong style="font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 22px;"><span style="color: rgb(204, 51, 0);">****</span></span></strong><br />
		<br />
		<strong><span style="color:#0066cc;"><u><span style="font-size:22px;"><img alt="linha.png" src="/getattachment/Home/linha.png.aspx;;?width=850&amp;height=7" style="width: 850px; height: 7px;" title="linha.png" /><br />
		<br />
		Engineering, Technology &amp; Innovation Management Beyond 2020:<br />
		<br />
		New Challenges, New Approaches</span></u></span></strong></div>
	&nbsp;<br />
	<div style="text-align: justify;">
		<span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif;"><span style="text-align: justify; font-size: 14px;">In the last two decades, the 23<sup>rd</sup> ICE/IEEE ITMC Conference has brought together leading academics, researchers and practitioners, contributing to the global debate on&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size: 14px;">research, science and innovation</span><span style="font-family:arial,helvetica,sans-serif;"><span style="text-align: justify; font-size: 14px;">.&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size: 14px;">This year, we would like&nbsp; to invite our growing community of researchers, innovators, industrialists, engineers and practitioners to share their insights</span><span style="font-size: 14px; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">, practices, projects and case studies that address the conference theme: <span style="color:#0066cc;"><em>&quot;</em></span></span><span style="font-size:14px;"><span style="color:#0066cc;"><em><strong>Engineering, Technology &amp; Innovation Management Beyond 2020: New Challenges, New Approaches&quot;</strong></em></span><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">.</span></span><br />
		&nbsp;</div>
	<div style="text-align: justify;">
		<span style="font-size: 14px;">The 23</span><sup>rd</sup><span style="font-size: 14px;">&nbsp;ICE/IEEE International Technology Management Conference will take place on the 27</span><sup>th</sup><span style="font-size: 14px;">,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14px;">28</span><sup>th</sup><span style="font-size: 14px;">&nbsp;and 29</span><sup>th</sup><span style="font-size: 14px;">&nbsp;June 2017, in <a href="http://www.visitmadeira.pt/en-gb/homepage?AreaId=16" target="_blank"><span style="color:#0066cc;">M</span></a></span><span style="font-size: 14px;"><a href="http://www.visitmadeira.pt/en-gb/homepage?AreaId=16" target="_blank"><span style="color:#0066cc;">adeira Island</span></a> (Portugal),&nbsp;organized by Faculdade de Ciências e Tecnologia da Universidade NOVA de Lisboa, UNINOVA together with Universidade do Minho. 23<sup>rd</sup>&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14px;">ICE/IEEE ITMC is a place where research, science and innovation is called for original&nbsp;i</span><span style="font-size: 14px;">deas,&nbsp;papers, d</span><span style="font-size: 14px;">ebates, initiatives&nbsp;and&nbsp;projects. Authors, workshop / tutorial organizers, and participants are invited to contribute to the shaping of the pros</span><span style="font-size: 14px;">pective on&nbsp;engineering, technology and innovation solutions for industry and societal challenges.</span></div>
</div>
<div>
	<div style="text-align: justify;">
		&nbsp;</div>
</div>
<div style="text-align: justify;">
	<span style="font-size: 14px;">ICE/IEEE ITMC 2017 conference will include distinguished keynote speakers, an original set of paper sessions, workshops, &nbsp;presentations and round tables.<br />
	<br />
	A three-day doctoral school, NITIM (European graduate school on Networks, Information, Technology and Innovation Management) is offered upon the conference.</span></div>
<div style="text-align: justify;">
	<br />
	<strong style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12.8px;"><i><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 102, 204); background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">At ICE/IEEE ITMC 2017 we are proud to announce that outstanding papers will be invited to be submitted in special issues organized by prestigious&nbsp;indexed international journals, with fast track selection</span></i><span style="color:#0066cc;"><em><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;"> </span></em></span></strong><span style="font-size:14px;"><span style="color:#0066cc;"><em>(<u><a href="http://www.ice-conference.org/Home/Call-for-Papers.aspx" target="_blank">see details</a></u>).</em></span></span><br />
	<br />
	<span style="font-size: 14px;">In addition to the possibility of submitting selected papers to these journals, there will once again be an opportunity to interact with editors from our associated journals in a &ldquo;Meet the Editors&rdquo; workshop (full details of this will be announced soon).&nbsp;</span><br />
	<br />
	<span style="font-size: 14px;">ICE Conference is one of the premier conferences associated to the </span><a href="http://ieee-tems.org/" style="font-size: 14px;">IEEE Technology and Engineering Management Society</a><span style="font-size: 14px;"> (IEEE TEMS).&nbsp;</span></div>
<div style="text-align: justify;">
	<br />
	<br />
	<div style="text-align: right;">
		<br />
		<span style="font-size:22px;"><strong><span style="color:#0066cc;"><u>Important Dates</u></span></strong></span></div>
	<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width:100.0%;" width="100%">
		<tbody>
			<tr>
				<td style="width:53.32%;">
					<div style="text-align: center;">
						<span style="font-size:14px;">Don&rsquo;t miss the opportunity to <strong><u>become member of the ICE/IEEE ITMC 2017 International Organizing Committee!</u></strong><br />
						&nbsp;</span><br />
						<br />
						<br />
						<br />
						<br />
						<span style="font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;">Send your&nbsp;</span><strong style="font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;"><u>expression of interest</u></strong><span style="font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;">&nbsp;to submit a paper, organise a track, a session or workshop to&nbsp;</span><strong style="font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;"><u><a href="mailto:ice2017_chair@uninova.pt">ice2017_chair@uninova.pt</a></u></strong></div>
					<span style="font-size:14px;">&nbsp;</span></td>
				<td style="width: 46.68%; text-align: right;">
					<br />
					<span style="font-size:14px;"><strong><span style="color:#3366ff;">If you have any constraints regarding any of the deadlines, please contact promptly the conference chair: </span><u><a href="mailto:ice2017_chair@uninova.pt"><span style="color:#3366ff;">ice2017_chair@uninova.pt</span></a></u></strong></span><br />
					<br />
					<br />
					<span style="font-size:14px;"><span style="color:#cc3300;"><strong>Session, Workshop and Tutorial Proposal Submission</strong></span><br />
					<del>10<sup>th</sup>&nbsp;February 2017</del> (<strong>Extended 15<sup>th</sup></strong></span><span style="font-size: 14px;"><strong>&nbsp;April 2017</strong>)</span><br />
					<span style="font-size:14px;">&nbsp;<br />
					<strong><span style="color:#cc3300;">Full Paper Submission</span></strong><br />
					<del><u>21<sup>st</sup> March 2017</u></del> (<span style="font-size:16px;"><strong>Extended 15<sup>th</sup> April 2017</strong></span>)<br />
					<br />
					<strong><span style="color:#cc3300;">Poster Submission</span></strong><br />
					<del><u>31<sup>st</sup> March 2017</u></del> <span style="font-size:16px;">(<strong>Extended 15<sup>th</sup> April 2017</strong>)</span><br />
					&nbsp;<br />
					<strong><span style="color:#cc3300;">Full Paper and Poster notification of Acceptance</span></strong><br />
					Reviews are performed as soon as papers are handed in, early submissions are strongly encouraged<br />
					&nbsp;<br />
					<strong><span style="color:#cc3300;">Print-ready final papers, copy-right form</span></strong><br />
					<u>16<sup>th</sup> May 2017</u><br />
					&nbsp;</span></td>
			</tr>
		</tbody>
	</table>
</div>
<div>
	<div style="text-align: justify;">

theForm.oldSubmit = theForm.submit;
theForm.submit = WebForm_SaveScrollPositionSubmit;

theForm.oldOnSubmit = theForm.onsubmit;
theForm.onsubmit = WebForm_SaveScrollPositionOnSubmit;
//]]>
</script>
</form>
</body>
</html>
